benchmark_details.name: Generalized Cross-domain Few-shot (GCFS) Task
benchmark_details.overview: The GCFS task focuses on adapting a source-pretrained model for high performance on both common and novel classes in a target domain with few-shot samples, addressing challenges related to data scarcity and domain adaptation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a framework for rapid deployment of 3D object detection models in diverse environments with few-shot learning.

data.size: ∼28K samples from NuScenes, ∼24K from Waymo, ∼7K from KITTI, ∼12K from A2D2

methodology.calculation: Based on Average Precision (AP) at 40 recall positions for each class.
methodology.interpretation: High mAP indicates strong performance in detecting both common and novel objects.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against VoxelRCNN and other SOTA methods.
methodology.validation: Conducted through comprehensive experiments across different K-shot settings.
